subject: ENGLISH
text: Suggest a brief and appropriate title for the passage.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Into how many sections does the passage naturally fall? Give the first two and the last two words of each section.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Explain carefully the following phrases as they are used in the passage: were first reclaimed from wildness; all the suitable material has been long since worked out; every animal of any pretensions; though half unconsciously.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Give the meaning of the following words as they are used in the passage: submit; hypothesis; stringent.

subject: ENGLISH
text: i) Write down a word that is opposite in meaning to each of the following words: ancestors; subsequent; rude.

subject: ENGLISH
text: ii) Distinguish shades of meaning in the following words: barbarian, barbarous, barbaric.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Make a general analysis into clauses of the sentence: The failure...worked out.

subject: ENGLISH
text: i) What part of the verb is each of these words: doing; following.

subject: ENGLISH
text: ii) Write down the singular of species and the plural of hypothesis.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Name the figure of speech used in the sentence: My conclusion...man. Comment on the aptness of its use in this passage.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Make a summary of the passage, bringing out the main points of the argument as clearly and succinctly as you can.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Rewrite, with the addition of all the proper marks of punctuation, the following passage.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Combine the substance of the following statements into a well-knit paragraph.

subject: ENGLISH
text: Write sentences which not only include but bring out clearly the meaning of any five of the following words: rhythmical; insistent; alloy; parasite; allude; perforate; long-term; recess; gruesome; absorb.
